halloween hacks... amazing

to scare you... boooo

all the way over there?

for trying it out and confirming it works it doesn't need to be reasonable yet

but it sounds like it was more of an intended accident that it is rta possible
does the block still work then
np
if you do it on the left how do you get the feather

oh i had somehow paused the stream while you were gone, good job me
i had just assumed it took a while
my one idea doesn't work :(
it actually wouldn't have worked for another reason probably but i was going to worry about that later
unless I'm misremembering maybe you should replay the yoshi cave
(i'm pretty sure tongue latching onto things only works downwards)
unless I'm misremembering, latching onto things calculates tongue with carry and snapping tongued sprite to tongue does not
you would've run into it eventually :)
i guess you might've assumed tongue works either way and unless you forgot the intended solution and tried it upwards that's fair
i'm also disappointed that the reznor platform does not carry you into the pipe
would be great if i was just wrong, but I'm pretty sure I have stuff to fix if that's the case
just use cheats tbh
oh nvm, I'm no longer disappointed
gl villains bravet10Stare
oh
well that's much better than what i was trying
pretty sure mine would've worked but gotten stuck immediately after
ok so i checked why reznor moves sprite 0
it uses the routine to attach the mode 7 tilemap to the sprite by setting the position of slot 0 to the mode 7 wheel's center and running the routine on slot 0
Rta viable TakeNRG
at least you can retry it after like 10 seconds :)
what about the shell?
can you not use that as slot 0?
i mean, slot 0 is just in the middle of the reznor
what'd you use the blue p-switch block for?
right, the reznor thing
I haven't seen this hack in a while.
turn blocks :D
i guess you can't actually use yoshi for the bridge thing
it's tongue wouldn't be out long enough probably
really?
did somebody want to RTA this?
right you can't despawn
*technically* you can but uh
yeah
well actually maybe not but i thought jam it into the wall at 56,18 then scroll left
unfortunate

Didn't that room have the monotone disco?
diso killing the koopa by accident sounds horrible RTA.

huh
official solution fish item swaps the shell.

ah well, unfortunate, would be curious to know what's supposed to be intended

and then I checked the video and there was a fish item swap.
I guess you need to do a frame-perfect double tongue, maybe he doesn't?

oh yeah reverie existed

yeah, as i've said, for me personally i think this third half just went too far
well for the fishbone puzzle I can say that one of the 3 ideas you threw out at the end of the last reverie stream and then didn't follow up on was the correct one
you have all messages so far translated

just try 3 random things, chances are you'll come up with the same 3 things.

glyph of genesis, yes

littlemixGG

so fun fact about what probably happened to me:
I am very convinced that I did 6 fish bones and it worked for me
yeah, so what I think happened is that because i didn't write down the sequence, I actually typed it in too slowly which caused the first glyph to not recognize as part of the sequence
because what I found when disassembling was if you do a wrong input the timer for the next input is shorter than when you do a correct input
so as long as you wait an in-between amount of time you can input an entire sequence and if a subsequence is correct it works
which is what I think happened probably
@TheBiob which room
also hello gl
pretty much
the fishbone room

who doesn't know oleic
all roads lead to noteblocks
weird how that works out
gg

gg

assuming you notice
and enter beginning
speedruns when?
already missed it
wdym the fruit isn't faded.
fruit not faded on first walkthrough is correct yeah
are you sure
yup
glyphs are randomized each playthrough
there's a couple of things that are
so another fun fact about my playthrough: I got a glyph of origin setup that can be mirrored to still be the same
so my origin glyphs and my genesis glyphs were the same
yup
it was quite amusing and made confirming that they're upside down a bit harder
yeah i should have excluded full mirrors from the randomization
but also i wasn't too worried about it i guess
oh yeah also I guess i can post my map now https://bin.smwcentral.net/u/28555/reverie_map_full%2B%2528SPOILER%2529.png

and one version isn't even on that map :)
it has everything but the center of origin which does actually have something but I think is inaccessible
moons are also in there
it sure is
oh yeah and you can see my glyphs in it
yeah it was very funny
i think the outside is always the same but the inner number can be any of 1-4
oh yeah that also meant that remember how you had to count to 23 in your first water puzzle?
well I had to count to 24!
(not factorial)
so uh, guess what i did
i decided to do all second half puzzles on a blind new save, meaning under 12min in-game
it was actually a fun challenge, took like 4/5 attempts
i timed out on the moon at one point :)
having all essences unlocked
@TheBiob LUL
you do actually get something for doing that but you don't need to do it on a blind save like i did
you need to do it under 12 min but you can do it on a save where you know the glyphs
yeah
the on the first attempt thing was just a challenge i decided on by myself
hope your notes were good :)
i wrote my route down on a vertical paint picture and scrolled through it while i was playing
you sure did things
thanks for playing
like the bonus rooms

ok so next week
